meanings.definition: A specified amount of money that the insured must pay before an insurance company will pay a claim.
meanings.sent1: Many insurance policies have deductibles that need to be paid first in case of an accident.
meanings.sent2: The deductible for my car insurance is $500, so I have to pay that amount before the insurance covers the rest.
meanings.sent3: I found it funny that I had to pay the deductible for my phone insurance just a week after buying the new phone.
meanings.sent4: The deductible felt like a toll booth on the road to getting my insurance claim approved.
meanings.sent5: Remember, the deductible is like the entrance fee to getting your insurance benefits.

meanings.definition: Amounts that are subtracted from one's income before taxes are calculated.
meanings.sent1: Some people choose higher deductibles to lower their taxable income.
meanings.sent2: The deductibles on my paycheck include health insurance and retirement contributions.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my deductibles were like little tax ninjas stealthily reducing my taxable income.
meanings.sent4: The deductibles acted as invisible shields protecting a portion of my income from taxes.
meanings.sent5: Think of deductibles as secret agents that sneakily reduce the amount of money you have to pay taxes on.
